intro: Chaetogastra longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled chaetogastra, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces long, slender styles that extend beyond the petals, a feature that is unique to this species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is not widely cultivated.
